snippet: Because of a corporate spat, Nickelodeon, owned by Viacom, has disappeared from DirecTV’s lineup, giving the Disney Channel, the Cartoon Network and other channels an edge.
abstract: Viacom's Nickelodeon has disappeared from DirecTV’s lineup because of a corporate spat, giving the Disney Channel, the Cartoon Network and other channels for children an edge; Disney, which had already been gaining on Nickelodeon, seemingly picked up some of the disappearing audience, though it is hard to draw a direct connection between the DirecTV blackout and the Disney gains.
lead_paragraph: Because of a corporate spat, Nickelodeon, owned by Viacom, has disappeared from DirecTV’s lineup, giving the Disney Channel, the Cartoon Network and other channels an edge.

headline.seo: Dispute With DirecTV Aids Viacom’s Rivals in Children’s Programming
headline.main: Denied Nickelodeon, DirecTV’s Youngest Clients Find Substitutes
headline.print_headline: Denied Nickelodeon, DirecTV’s Youngest Clients Find Substitutes
